Class PID

  • java.lang.Object
    • PID

  • public class PID
extends java.lang.Object
    General purpose PID loop.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PID(signal functions)
      This constructs the PID based on a signal interface.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static double clamp(double valueToClamp, double clampValue)
      Clamps a value into a range.
      void fill_error(double e)
      Fills the error stack so that it doesn't break in steady state instantly.
      double get_error()
      Gets the current error.
      double get()
      Get the controller output.
      void set_derivative_range(int n)
      In the case of a derivative filter for smoothness, this sets the number of iterations of derivative to keep track of.
      void set_error_range(int n)
      Set how many error values to keep track of.
      void set_error_sample_rate(double n)
      Sets the error sample rate in seconds.
      void set_integral_activation_range(double n)
      If you need integral windup to only occur withing an error range, pass the range to this method.
      void set_integral_sum(double i)
      Sets the integral sum.
      void set_pid(double p, double i, double d)
      Sets PID coeficients.
      void set_setpoint(double s)
      Sets the controller setpoint value.
      void set_sp_ramp(PID sp_pid)
      Sets the sp ramp controller.
      double steady_state_error()
      Gets the steady state error of the controller.
      void take_prev_error_value()
      Sets the previous_error to the cuttent error.
      void update(double dt)
      Should be called every cycle for controller to be updated.

        This constructs the PID based on a signal interface.

    • Method Detail

      • set_integral_activation_range

        public void set_integral_activation_range(double n)
        If you need integral windup to only occur withing an error range, pass the range to this method.
        Parameters:
        range - for integral to windup in

      • set_derivative_range

        public void set_derivative_range(int n)
        In the case of a derivative filter for smoothness, this sets the number of iterations of derivative to keep track of.
        Parameters:
        number - of derivative values to store for filter

      • set_error_range

        public void set_error_range(int n)
        Set how many error values to keep track of. Used for getting steady state error.
        Parameters:
        number - of error values to keep track of.

      • set_error_sample_rate

        public void set_error_sample_rate(double n)
        Sets the error sample rate in seconds.
        Parameters:
        number - of seconds to wait between sample

      • set_setpoint

        public void set_setpoint(double s)
        Sets the controller setpoint value.
        Parameters:
        controller - setpoint

      • set_integral_sum

        public void set_integral_sum(double i)
        Sets the integral sum. ( if you want to be cheeky about your controller )
        Parameters:
        integral - sum

      • set_pid

        public void set_pid(double p,
                    double i,
                    double d)
        Sets PID coeficients.
        Parameters:
        proportional - coeficient, integral coeficient, derivative coeficient

      • set_sp_ramp

        public void set_sp_ramp(PID sp_pid)
        Sets the sp ramp controller. This is a raw feedback. No noise, perfect curve feedback controller to lead setpoint.
        Parameters:
        PID - controller to use for setpoint ramp.

      • fill_error

        public void fill_error(double e)
        Fills the error stack so that it doesn't break in steady state instantly.
        Parameters:
        predend - error value

      • steady_state_error

        public double steady_state_error()
        Gets the steady state error of the controller.
        Returns:
        average absolute error of the system according to the error stack

      • update

        public void update(double dt)
        Should be called every cycle for controller to be updated.
        Parameters:
        the - time it took for the last cycle to complete

      • get

        public double get()
        Get the controller output. This is most commonly a motor controller input.
        Returns:
        PID output

      • clamp

        public static double clamp(double valueToClamp,
                           double clampValue)
        Clamps a value into a range.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        value after clamp
